AK (6/12/01 4:59:54 PM)
	got this after running plugin-export ant script (i made one for jdtcore)
	about 15 (!) error dialogs opened it was hard to close the and dialog.
	everytime i tried i'd get another 15 or so error dialogs

here's the first walkback. the subsequent ones are quite similar (i got 600k of walkback text)
sorry for not giving exact steps. happened only once - never before.

NOTES:
EG (6/12/2001 5:10:53 AM)
	not reproduceable, but a PR to keep an eye on.
	moving to SWT

LK (6/12/01 11:26:57 AM)
	This could very well be fallout from "covering up" the Console/ConsoleDocument problem
	in 1GDX9PN: ITPUI:WINNT - ArrayIndexOutOfBounds in Console/StyledText.  A complete
	hack was put in to ignore the ArrayIndexOutOfBounds.  Line backgrounds are getting out of
	sync.  I sent email to KUM and DS about the problem and how it could be occurring.  I don't
	think anything was done on their part to try to fix the problem.  There's nothing more we can do until 
	we know how it is occurring.  I'm fairly sure the problem is that the Console/ConsoleDocument
	is somehow getting its line delimiters out of whack.  Also note that strange problems like this 
	only appear to be occurring with the Console (not other users of the StyledText widget).

KR (6/12/01 11:51:59 AM)
	The console (and any other StyledTextContent implementor) needs to ensure that the internal 
	line store is valid and can not be corrupted by the client.
	I got code (a release note editor) last week from RTP that failed with an exception in 
	StyledText.drawLine. The reason was that the code created document partitions that were invalid.
	They stopped in the middle of a CR/LF line delimiter. A subsequent formatting run corrupted the 
	lines in the document and led to the walkback in StyledText (the document returned a line with 
	length -1).
	These problems are very hard to debug (the Console case doesn't even seem to be reproducable)
	and should be prevented by the document.
We have not seen this problem since. Closing PR.
